result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business tomorrow. 
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment.
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.

The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.
The Defendant is granted jail credit of 2 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 1:01 PM Defendant Jennifer L Hamilton in court.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Vincent Kurta in court for Jennifer L Hamilton.  Cases 22CM19 and 22CM39.  Parties have an agreement.  State has complied with victim rights.  22CM39 CT 1 PLEADS NO CONTEST.  22CM19 CT 1 PLEADS NO CONTEST CT 2 DRI.  Each file contains PLQ, reviewed with attorney, understands information, understands elements and rights giving up.  Back on the record 1:09.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, willingly, and voluntarily pleading no contest accepts NO CONTEST PLEAS.   As a factual basis can court rely on information in the criminal compliant, court finds factual basis exists, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter on 22CM19 CT1 and 22CM39 CT 1 any remaining counts are DRI.  State comments on sentencing.  Attorney comments on sentencing.   Def has no comment.
